verbs.description: [ARG0: President Donald Trump] [V: argues] [ARG1: his new tariffs are needed in part to stem the trade deficit with Canada . But the US does not have a trade deficit with Canada] .
President Donald Trump argues his new tariffs [V: are] needed in part to stem the trade deficit with Canada . But the US does not have a trade deficit with Canada .
President Donald Trump argues [ARG1: his new tariffs] are [V: needed] [ARGM-ADV: in part] [ARGM-PRP: to stem the trade deficit with Canada] . But the US does not have a trade deficit with Canada .
President Donald Trump argues [ARG3: his new tariffs] are needed in part to [V: stem] [ARG1: the trade deficit with Canada] . But the US does not have a trade deficit with Canada .
President Donald Trump argues his new tariffs are needed in part to stem the trade deficit with Canada . But the US [V: does] not have a trade deficit with Canada .
President Donald Trump argues his new tariffs are needed in part to stem the trade deficit with Canada . But [ARG0: the US] does [ARGM-NEG: not] [V: have] [ARG1: a trade deficit with Canada] .
